summary: This document is an email chain regarding the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) concerning an electronic devices application form and a WiFi order. It involves communication between the judge's chambers and legal counsel, indicating procedural steps in the case.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Alison J. Nathan, whose chambers are involved in the email communication regarding the US v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Listed as a recipient in the email chain regarding the electronic devices application in the US v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Listed as a recipient in the email chain regarding the electronic devices application in the US v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who submitted the electronic devices application form.

connections.description: Judge Nathan's chambers communicating with attorney Christian Everdell regarding case procedures.
Judge Nathan's chambers communicating with attorney Laura Menninger regarding case procedures.
Prosecutor Jeff Pagliuca submitting an application to Judge Nathan's chambers.
Both attorneys are copied on the same legal communication regarding the Maxwell case.

events.title: Electronic Devices Application Submission
events.description: An electronic devices application form is submitted to the court in the US v. Maxwell case, accompanied by a WiFi order.

keyFacts: The document is part of the case US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
An electronic devices application form and a WiFi order were submitted to Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers.
The communication involves Assistant United States Attorney Jeff Pagliuca and defense attorneys Christian Everdell and Laura Menninger.
The email includes a caution about external emails, indicating security protocols.
The document shows ongoing legal procedures in the Maxwell case as of November 2021.
